data.text:
Spanish is the official language of twenty-one countries…

Mexico

Location: Southern part of North America and Northern part of Central America. Borders with the USA Guatemala and Belize, coasts to the Pacific Ocean, the Gulf of Mexico and the Caribbean Sea.

Capital: Mexico City

Area: 1,964,372 sq Km

117 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Spain

Location: Southwestern Europe, bordering the Bay of Biscay, Mediterranean Sea, North Atlantic Ocean, and Pyrenees Mountains, southwest of France.

Capital: Madrid

Area: 504,782 sq km

47 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Colombia

Location: Northern South America, bordering the Caribbean Sea, between Panama and Venezuela, and bordering the North Pacific Ocean, between Ecuador and Panama.

Capital: Bogota

Area: 1,138,910 sq km

47 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Argentina

Location: Southern South America, bordering the South Atlantic Ocean, between Chile and Uruguay, Bolivia, Brazil, and Paraguay.

Capital: Buenos Aires

Area: 3,766,890 sq km

42 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Venezuela

Location: Northern South America, bordering the Caribbean Sea and the North Atlantic Ocean, between Colombia and Guyana. Bordering Brazil to the South.

Capital: Caracas

Area: 912,050 sq km

30 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Peru

Location: Western South America, bordering the South Pacific Ocean, between Chile and Ecuador, bordering also Colombia, Brazil and Bolivia.

Capital: Lima

Area: 1,285,220 sq km

27 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Chile

Location: Southern South America, bordering the South Pacific Ocean, between Argentina and Peru. Bordering Bolivia to the East.

Capital: Santiago de Chile

Area: 756,950 sq km

17 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Ecuador

Location: Western South America, bordering the Pacific Ocean at the Equator, between Colombia and Peru.

Capital: Quito

Area: 283,560 sq km

16 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Guatemala

Location: Central America, bordering the North Pacific Ocean, between El Salvador and Mexico, and bordering the Gulf of Honduras (Caribbean Sea) between Honduras and Belize.

Capital: Guatemala

Area: 108,890 sq km

14 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Cuba

Location: Caribbean, island between the Caribbean Sea and the North Atlantic Ocean, 150 km south of Key West, Florida

Capital: Havana

Area: 110,860 sq km

12 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Dominican Republic

Location: Caribbean, eastern two-thirds of the island of Hispaniola, between the Caribbean Sea and the North Atlantic Ocean, east of Haiti.

Capital: Santo Domingo

Area: 48,730 sq km

11 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Bolivia

Location: Central South America, southwest of Brazil. border countries: Argentina 832 km, Brazil 3,400 km, Chile 861 km, Paraguay 750 km, Peru 900 km.

Capital: La Paz

Area: 1,098,580 sq km

10 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Honduras

Location: Central America, bordering the Caribbean Sea, between Guatemala and Nicaragua and bordering the Gulf of Fonseca (North Pacific Ocean), between El Salvador and Nicaragua.

Capital: Tegucigalpa

Area: 112,090 sq km

9 million speakers (as of 2006)1

El Salvador

Location: Central America, bordering the North Pacific Ocean, between Guatemala and Honduras.

Capital: San Salvador

Area: 21,040 sq km

7 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Nicaragua

Location: Central America, bordering both the Caribbean Sea and the North Pacific Ocean, between Costa Rica and Honduras

Capital: Managua

Area: 129,494 sq km

6 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Paraguay

Location: Central South America, northeast of Argentina.

Border countries: Argentina 1,880 km, Bolivia 750 km, Brazil 1,290 km

Capital: Asuncion

Area: 406,750 sq km

5 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Costa Rica

Location: Central America, bordering both the Caribbean Sea and the North Pacific Ocean, between Nicaragua and Panama.

Capital: San Jose

Area: 51,100 sq km

5 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Puerto Rico

Location: Caribbean, island between the Caribbean Sea and the North

Atlantic Ocean, east of the Dominican Republic.

Capital: San Juan

Area: 9,104 sq km

4 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Panama

Location: Central America, bordering both the Caribbean Sea and the North Pacific Ocean, between Colombia and Costa Rica.

Capital: Panama

Area: 78,200 sq km

4 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Uruguay

Location: Southern South America, bordering the South Atlantic Ocean, between Argentina and Brazil.

Capital: Montevideo

Area: 176,220 sq km

3.5 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Equatorial Guinea

Location: Western Africa, bordering the Bight of Biafra, between Cameroon and Gabon.

Capital: Malabo.

Area: 28,051 sq km

1 million speakers (as of 2006)1

Information gathered from CIA World Factbook, Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade, and various sources including Wikipedia website.

1.9 million (native speakers or very good speakers as a second language 2012) Germany 2.57 million (total number of Spanish speakers 2012);

645,000 (native speakers or very good speakers as a second language 2012) Gibraltar 23,000 (as of 2012) Guam 19,000 (as of 2006) Israel 175,000 (as of 2006) Luxembourg 30,000 (as of 2012) Morocco 3.42 million (total number of Spanish speakers 2012);

7,000 (native speakers or very good speakers as a second language 2012) Sweden 467,000 (total number of Spanish speakers 2012);

77,000 (native speakers or very good speakers as a second language 2012) Switzerland 111,000 (as of 2012) The Philippines 3 million (total number of Spanish speakers 2012);

438,000 (native speakers or very good speakers as a second language 2012) Turkey 14,000 (as of 2012) United States of America 52 million (total number of Spanish speakers 2012 including 7.8million students) Virgin Islands 17,000 (as of 2012) Western Sahara 22,000 (as of 2012)

Information gathered from the Wikipedia website.
